title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Loch Tummel is three miles long, and at the west end about two-thirds of a mile broad, contracting towards the east.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: For nearly five miles, -which is the distance from Garry Bridge* to the margin of the vale of Loch Tummel, the general features of this land of " the birch" continue with little

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The last division of scenery -which remains to be seen from Blair comprises that which extends from Garry Bridge to Loch Tummel.

title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: Loch Tummel is that which produces the finest trout ; as does that river upwards to Loch Rannoch, and even Loch Rannoch itself.

title: An American four-in-hand in Britain /
author: Carnegie, Andrew
snippet: About three miles north of it rises Ben Vracky, and within easy distances are Glen Tilt, Bruar Water, the Pass of Killicrankie, Loch Tummel, the Falls of Tummel, and other places well worthy of a visit ; but as the Gay Charioteers' time was limited they could pay their respects to only a few of them.
